title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement songqi.duan@outlook.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Songqi Duan. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Duan S (2023). catplot: Capable Tity Plot Tools. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/zerostwo/catplot.
code: @Manual{,   title = {catplot: Capable And Tity Plot Tools},   author = {Songqi Duan},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/zerostwo/catplot}, }

title: Capable And Tity Plot Tools
text: catplot capable tity data visualization tool maintained Songqi Duan.

title: Capable And Tity Plot Tools
text: Install latest version GitHub follow:
code: if (!require(devtools)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("zerostwo/catplot")

title: Capable And Tity Plot Tools
code: library(catplot) library(ggplot2)  data("iris") p <- ggplot(   data = iris,   aes(     x = Species,     y = Sepal.Length   ) ) +   geom_boxplot() +   theme_cat(     aspect_ratio = 1,     show_panel_grid = "both",     show_title = "y"   ) p

title: Capable And Tity Plot Tools
text: Please note catplot project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Create a boxplot with customized options using ggplot2 — cat_boxplot
title: Create a boxplot with customized options using ggplot2 — cat_boxplot
text: function creates grouped boxplot optional jitter points. takes data frame, x variable, y variable, fill variable, color variable, various arguments customize plot.

title: Create a boxplot with customized options using ggplot2 — cat_boxplot
code: cat_boxplot(   data,   x,   y,   fill = NULL,   color = NULL,   x_order = NULL,   y_order = NULL,   width = 0.4,   fatten = 1,   outlier_colour = NULL,   outlier_color = NULL,   outlier_fill = NULL,   outlier_shape = 19,   outlier_size = 0.5,   outlier_stroke = 0.5,   outlier_alpha = NULL,   notch = FALSE,   notchwidth = 0.5,   varwidth = FALSE,   na_rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show_legend = FALSE,   add_jitter = FALSE,   jitter_width = 0.6,   jitter_size = 0.5,   jitter_color = NULL,   plot_title = waiver(),   x_axis_title = waiver(),   y_axis_title = waiver(),   x_text_angle = NULL,   y_text_angle = NULL,   legend_title = waiver(),   font_size = 8,   linewidth = 0.5,   aspect_ratio = NULL,   frame = "closed",   show_panel_grid = "both_not",   show_title = "both",   show_text = "both",   text_italic = "both_not",   show_ticks = "both",   ticks_length = 4,   legend_position = "right",   legend_direction = NULL,   comparisons = NULL,   test = "wilcox.test",   step_increase = 0.1,   map_signif_level = TRUE )

title: Create a boxplot with customized options using ggplot2 — cat_boxplot
text: data data frame modified. x column name data frame adjusted factor levels. y column name data frame adjusted factor levels. fill character string representing color use box plot fill color character string representing color use box plot outline x_order Optional. character vector specifying adjust factor levels x column. can one following: "desc" (arrange descending order according mean value), "asc" (arrange ascending order according mean value), vector factor levels desired order, NULL (change). y_order Optional. character vector specifying adjust factor levels y column. can one following: "desc" (arrange descending order according mean value), "asc" (arrange ascending order according mean value), vector factor levels desired order, NULL (change). width numeric value indicating width boxplot. Defaults 0.4. fatten numeric value indicating amount increase width boxplot relative default. Defaults 1. outlier_colour Deprecated. Use outlier_color instead. outlier_color character string symbol indicating color outlier points. Defaults NULL. outlier_fill character string symbol indicating fill color outlier points. Defaults NULL. outlier_shape integer indicating shape outlier points. Defaults 19. outlier_size numeric value indicating size outlier points. Defaults 0.5. outlier_stroke numeric value indicating stroke width outlier points. Defaults 0.5. outlier_alpha numeric value indicating alpha transparency outlier points. Defaults NULL. notch logical value indicating whether display notches around median. Defaults FALSE. notchwidth numeric value indicating width notches. Defaults 0.5. varwidth logical value indicating whether adjust width boxplot based number observations. Defaults FALSE. na_rm logical value indicating whether remove missing values. Defaults FALSE. orientation character string indicating whether plot horizontal ("horizontal") vertical ("vertical"). Defaults NA. show_legend logical value indicating whether show legend. Defaults FALSE. add_jitter logical value indicating whether add jitter points plot. Defaults FALSE. jitter_width numeric value indicating width jitter points. Defaults 0.6. jitter_size numeric value indicating size jitter points. Defaults 0.5. jitter_color character string symbol indicating variable use color jitter points. Defaults NULL. plot_title character string representing title plot x_axis_title character string representing title x-axis y_axis_title character string representing title y-axis x_text_angle integer representing angle x-axis text labels y_text_angle integer representing angle y-axis text labels legend_title character string representing title plot legend font_size Numeric, font size (default: 8) linewidth Numeric, line width (default: 0.5) aspect_ratio Numeric, aspect ratio plot (default: NULL) frame Character, frame type, "closed" "open" (default: "closed") show_panel_grid Character, panel grid visibility (default: "both_not") show_title Character, axis title visibility (default: "") show_text Character, axis text visibility (default: "") text_italic Character, axis text italicization (default: "both_not") show_ticks Character, axis tick visibility (default: "") ticks_length Numeric, tick length (default: 4) legend_position Character, position legend (default: "right") legend_direction Character, direction legend (default: NULL) comparisons list comparison groups ggsignif test character string representing statistical test use ggsignif step_increase numeric value representing step increase ggsignif map_signif_level logical value representing whether map significance level ggsignif

title: Create a boxplot with customized options using ggplot2 — cat_boxplot
text: ggplot object representing grouped boxplot optional jitter   points.

title: Create a boxplot with customized options using ggplot2 — cat_boxplot
code: library(catplot) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  data("iris") iris %>%   mutate(group = if_else(log2(Petal.Length + 1) > 1.5,     "high", "low"   )) %>%   cat_boxplot(     x = Species,     y = log2(Petal.Width + 1),     fill = group,     aspect_ratio = 1,     show_panel_grid = "both",     legend_title = "ee",     legend_position = "top",     x_text_angle = 45   )   p <- iris %>%   cat_boxplot(     x = Species,     y = Sepal.Length,     aspect_ratio = 2,     frame = "open",     x_text_angle = 45,     comparisons = list(c("versicolor", "virginica"))   ) + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Paired") p

what: Modify factor levels of data — cat_modify_data
title: Modify factor levels of data — cat_modify_data
text: function used adjust factor levels data based x_order y_order inputs.

title: Modify factor levels of data — cat_modify_data
code: cat_modify_data(data, x, y, x_order = NULL, y_order = NULL)

title: Modify factor levels of data — cat_modify_data
text: data data frame modified. x column name data frame adjusted factor levels. y column name data frame adjusted factor levels. x_order Optional. character vector specifying adjust factor levels x column. can one following: "desc" (arrange descending order according mean value), "asc" (arrange ascending order according mean value), vector factor levels desired order, NULL (change). y_order Optional. character vector specifying adjust factor levels y column. can one following: "desc" (arrange descending order according mean value), "asc" (arrange ascending order according mean value), vector factor levels desired order, NULL (change).

title: Modify factor levels of data — cat_modify_data
text: modified data frame adjusted factor levels.

title: Modify factor levels of data — cat_modify_data
code: library(catplot) data(iris) head(cat_modify_data(   data = iris,   x = Species,   y = Sepal.Length,   x_order =     c("virginica", "versicolor", "setosa") )) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa head(cat_modify_data(   data = iris,   x = Species,   y = Sepal.Length,   x_order = "desc" )) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa #> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa #> 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa

what: Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif comparisons — cat_modify_plot
title: Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif comparisons — cat_modify_plot
text: function modifies ggplot2 plot adding custom theme, plot title, axis labels, ggsignif comparisons. function returns list ggplot2 objects can used modify plot.

title: Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif comparisons — cat_modify_plot
code: cat_modify_plot(   plot_title = waiver(),   x_axis_title = waiver(),   y_axis_title = waiver(),   x_text_angle = NULL,   y_text_angle = NULL,   legend_title = waiver(),   font_size = 8,   linewidth = 0.5,   aspect_ratio = NULL,   frame = "closed",   show_panel_grid = "both_not",   show_title = "both",   show_text = "both",   text_italic = "both_not",   show_ticks = "both",   ticks_length = 4,   legend_position = "right",   legend_direction = NULL,   comparisons = NULL,   test = "wilcox.test",   step_increase = 0.1,   map_signif_level = TRUE )

title: Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif comparisons — cat_modify_plot
text: plot_title character string representing title plot x_axis_title character string representing title x-axis y_axis_title character string representing title y-axis x_text_angle integer representing angle x-axis text labels y_text_angle integer representing angle y-axis text labels legend_title character string representing title plot legend font_size Numeric, font size (default: 8) linewidth Numeric, line width (default: 0.5) aspect_ratio Numeric, aspect ratio plot (default: NULL) frame Character, frame type, "closed" "open" (default: "closed") show_panel_grid Character, panel grid visibility (default: "both_not") show_title Character, axis title visibility (default: "") show_text Character, axis text visibility (default: "") text_italic Character, axis text italicization (default: "both_not") show_ticks Character, axis tick visibility (default: "") ticks_length Numeric, tick length (default: 4) legend_position Character, position legend (default: "right") legend_direction Character, direction legend (default: NULL) comparisons list comparison groups ggsignif test character string representing statistical test use ggsignif step_increase numeric value representing step increase ggsignif map_signif_level logical value representing whether map significance level ggsignif

title: Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif comparisons — cat_modify_plot
text: list ggplot2 objects can used modify plot

title: Modify a ggplot2 plot with custom theme, title, axis labels, and ggsignif comparisons — cat_modify_plot
code: library(ggplot2) library(catplot)  # Create a plot data(mtcars) p <-   ggplot(mtcars, aes(     x = factor(cyl),     y = mpg,     fill = factor(gear)   )) +   geom_boxplot() +   labs(title = "Miles per Gallon by Cylinder and Gear",        x = "Cylinder",        y = "Miles per Gallon",        fill = "Gear")  # Modify the plot with custom theme, title, and axis labels p + cat_modify_plot(   plot_title = "Miles per Gallon by Cylinder and Gear",   x_axis_title = "Cylinder",   y_axis_title = "Miles per Gallon" )   # Modify the plot with custom ggsignif comparisons p + cat_modify_plot(comparisons = list(c("4", "6"), c("4", "8"), c("6", "8")),                     test = "t.test")   # Modify the plot with custom theme and ggsignif comparisons p + cat_modify_plot(   font_size = 12,   linewidth = 1,   comparisons = list(c("4", "6"), c("4", "8"), c("6", "8")),   test = "t.test" )

what: Create a box plot with customizable color or fill — geom_boxplot_internal
title: Create a box plot with customizable color or fill — geom_boxplot_internal
text: function creates box plot using geom_boxplot() function ggplot2 package. color fill aesthetic can customized using color fill parameter, respectively.

title: Create a box plot with customizable color or fill — geom_boxplot_internal
code: geom_boxplot_internal(color = NULL, fill = NULL, ...)

title: Create a box plot with customizable color or fill — geom_boxplot_internal
text: color character string representing color use box plot outline fill character string representing color use box plot fill ... Additional arguments passed geom_boxplot

title: Create a box plot with customizable color or fill — geom_boxplot_internal
text: ggplot object box plot

title: Create a box plot with customizable color or fill — geom_boxplot_internal
code: library(catplot) library(ggplot2) # Create a box plot with red outline geom_boxplot_internal(color = "red") #> geom_boxplot: outlier.colour = NULL, outlier.fill = NULL, outlier.shape = 19, outlier.size = 1.5, outlier.stroke = 0.5, outlier.alpha = NULL, notch = FALSE, notchwidth = 0.5, varwidth = FALSE, na.rm = FALSE, orientation = NA #> stat_boxplot: na.rm = FALSE, orientation = NA #> position_dodge2   # Create a box plot with green fill geom_boxplot_internal(fill = "green") #> geom_boxplot: outlier.colour = NULL, outlier.fill = NULL, outlier.shape = 19, outlier.size = 1.5, outlier.stroke = 0.5, outlier.alpha = NULL, notch = FALSE, notchwidth = 0.5, varwidth = FALSE, na.rm = FALSE, orientation = NA #> stat_boxplot: na.rm = FALSE, orientation = NA #> position_dodge2   # Create a box plot with custom data data <- data.frame(x = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 10), y = rnorm(20)) ggplot(data, aes(x, y)) +   geom_boxplot_internal(color = "blue", fill = "yellow")

what: Check if a variable is a character or factor — is_char_or_factor
title: Check if a variable is a character or factor — is_char_or_factor
text: function checks variable character factor.

title: Check if a variable is a character or factor — is_char_or_factor
code: is_char_or_factor(x)

title: Check if a variable is a character or factor — is_char_or_factor
text: x variable checked.

title: Check if a variable is a character or factor — is_char_or_factor
text: logical value indicating whether variable character factor.

title: Check if a variable is a character or factor — is_char_or_factor
code: library(catplot) is_char_or_factor("hello") #> [1] TRUE is_char_or_factor(factor("world")) #> [1] TRUE

what: Check if a string is a valid color — is_color
title: Check if a string is a valid color — is_color
text: function attempts convert string RGB value using col2rgb() function grDevices package. RGB value empty, string considered valid color.

title: Check if a string is a valid color — is_color
code: is_color(str)

title: Check if a string is a valid color — is_color
text: str character string representing color

title: Check if a string is a valid color — is_color
text: logical value indicating whether input valid color

title: Check if a string is a valid color — is_color
code: library(catplot) is_color("red") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE is_color("#00FF00") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE is_color("not a color") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE

title: Custom theme for catplot — theme_cat
text: Custom theme catplot

title: Custom theme for catplot — theme_cat
code: theme_cat(   font_size = 8,   linewidth = 0.5,   aspect_ratio = NULL,   frame = "closed",   show_panel_grid = "both_not",   show_title = "both",   show_text = "both",   text_italic = "both_not",   show_ticks = "both",   ticks_length = 4,   legend_position = "right",   legend_direction = NULL )

title: Custom theme for catplot — theme_cat
text: font_size Numeric, font size (default: 8) linewidth Numeric, line width (default: 0.5) aspect_ratio Numeric, aspect ratio plot (default: NULL) frame Character, frame type, "closed" "open" (default: "closed") show_panel_grid Character, panel grid visibility (default: "both_not") show_title Character, axis title visibility (default: "") show_text Character, axis text visibility (default: "") text_italic Character, axis text italicization (default: "both_not") show_ticks Character, axis tick visibility (default: "") ticks_length Numeric, tick length (default: 4) legend_position Character, position legend (default: "right") legend_direction Character, direction legend (default: NULL)

title: Custom theme for catplot — theme_cat
text: ggplot2 theme

title: Custom theme for catplot — theme_cat
code: library(catplot) library(ggplot2)  p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = manufacturer, y = hwy)) +   geom_point() p + theme_cat()
